text.p: Huntingdon Life Sciences Group Plc Plc said on Friday that the London stock exchange had agreed to the company's request to suspend its shares.
The suspension was requested while the company prepares its response to the government's decision, announced yesterday, to revoke the company's licence to conduct experiments on animals.
The shares were suspended on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday.
Home Office junior minister George Howarth warned the move could shut the company down, with the loss of 1,400 jobs.
Huntingdon shares closed yesterday at 54 pence.
Howarth said that if the company remedied "extremely serious" failures and omissions at its plant the government would be prepared to consider an application for a replacement certificate.
